TopicTitle: Not sure how to update to BETA than ever.

Articles.Content:
So, how is this done? My current install is v0.23.5.464 . I'd like to save my progress, if possible. I just made it to Duna and back!

Thanks!

Before we go anywhere, back up your save. There is a very good chance something is going to break. If you have the Steam version, it should automatically update -- just make sure you run the x32 executable to start the game. Otherwise, you'll need to run the Launcher.exe so it can begin to patch the game to the latest version.

Due to some files being reshuffled, in order to avoid glitches you're going to need to delete the Squad folder located in GameData; Steam, or the patcher, will automatically retrieve the correct files for the latest version. Once all the files are downloaded, you can try loading up your save game. If it is a Career save, you may have some issues, as 0.90 introduced the upgradeable buildings, as well as a great many other things.

If you experience issues trying to play your savegame, the best thing to do is create a brand-new savegame so that you have a 'correct' 0.90 save file to look at. Open your old save and the new save side by side in a text editor, and compare them. You should find multiple blocks of information in the new save that you did not have in the old save; copy these across to the old save, but be careful not to leave blank lines in your save and make sure to preserve the structure of the file (essentially, make sure there are the same number of } as there are of {).

I'm not quite sure how you'll have gotten the full version for free. If you had the game gifted via Steam, it will update via Steam. If you got a store key, you'll already have an account with the KSP Store that you used to redeem the key, so you can either download via there or put your store details into the KSP patcher. I'd recommend just downloading the latest version over using the patcher at present. If someone has just made a copy of the game for you, that's an unauthorised copy and there's not much we can do.
